intro: Crypsinus majoensis, commonly known as the Majoensis Cryptostegia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a slightly hairy surface. Crypsinus majoensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within forest understories.
